ISSUE.TITLE: podman v4.0.2: play kube command ignores hostNetwork directive in pod description
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST? (leave only one on its own line)** /kind bug **Description** In podman v4.0.2 `podman play kube` command does not respect the hostNetwork parameter in a pod spec. On the other hand, podman v3.4.7 works as expected. Similar issue for older 3.x releases has been fixed ~2 years ago: see https://github.com/containers/podman/issues/4432 **Steps to reproduce the issue:** 1. Create a pod description that uses the hostNetwork parameter: Use simple httpd container to check accessibility from host: ``` $ cat test1.yaml apiVersion: v1 kind: Pod metadata: creationTimestamp: "2022-04-26T15:06:25Z" labels: app: mypod name: mypod spec: restartPolicy: Never hostNetwork: true containers: - image: docker.io/library/httpd:latest name: blissfulpayne resources: {} securityContext: capabilities: drop: - CAP_MKNOD - CAP_NET_RAW - CAP_AUDIT_WRITE tty: true ``` 3. Check container using podman v4.0.2 ``` $ podman --version podman version 4.0.2 $ podman play kube test1.yaml $ wget localhost:80 -O - Connecting to localhost:80 (127.0.0.1:80) wget: can't connect to remote host (127.0.0.1): Connection refused $ podman pod rm mypod -f ``` 3. Check container using podman v3.4.7 ``` $ ./podman --version podman version 3.4.7 $ ./podman play kube test1.yaml $ wget localhost:80 -O - Connecting to localhost:80 (127.0.0.1:80) writing to stdout

It works!

- 100% |******************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************| 45 0:00:00 ETA written to stdout $ ./podman pod rm mypod -f ``` **Describe the results you received:** See above. **Describe the results you expected:** I would expect the container to run in the host network namespace. This is what I get when I am using podman v3.4.7. COMMIT.MESSAGE: play kube respect hostNetwork We need to use the host network when it is set in the config and --network was not used. This regression was added in 3e9af2029f1f. Fixes #14015 Signed-off-by: Paul Holzinger <pholzing@redhat.com>
